text: Resolution adopted by the General Assembly on 23 December 2016
[without reference to a Main Committee (A/71/L.23)]
71/256.	New Urban Agenda
The General Assembly,

Recalling its resolution 67/216 of 21 December 2012, in which it decided to convene the United Nations Conference on Housing and Sustainable Urban Development (Habitat III), as well as its resolutions 68/239 of 27 December 2013, 69/226 of 19 December 2014 and 70/210 of 22 December 2015,
textWithHighlights: *Recalling* its resolution 67/216 of 21 December 2012, in which it decided to convene the United Nations Conference on Housing and Sustainable Urban Development (Habitat III), as well as its resolutions 68/239 of 27 December 2013, 69/226 of 19 December 2014 and 70/210 of 22 December 2015,

text: Expresses its profound gratitude to the Government and the people of Ecuador for hosting the United Nations Conference on Housing and Sustainable Urban Development (Habitat III) from 17 to 20 October 2016 and for providing all the necessary support;

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: Government and the people of Ecuador

textWithHighlights: *Expresses its profound gratitude* to the {{Government and the people of Ecuador}} for hosting the United Nations Conference on Housing and Sustainable Urban Development (Habitat III) from 17 to 20 October 2016 and for providing all the necessary support;
uncertainties: Treating “Expresses its profound gratitude” as an evaluative operative verb (normalized to “express”), analogous to other evaluative formulations like “appreciate/commend,” though “express gratitude” is not explicitly listed in the verb set.

text: Endorses the New Urban Agenda adopted by the United Nations Conference on Housing and Sustainable Urban Development (Habitat III), which is contained in the annex to the present resolution.
textWithHighlights: *Endorses* the New Urban Agenda adopted by the United Nations Conference on Housing and Sustainable Urban Development (Habitat III), which is contained in the annex to the present resolution.

text:
68th plenary meeting
23 December 2016
Annex
New Urban Agenda
Quito Declaration on Sustainable Cities and Human Settlements for All

We, Heads of State and Government, Ministers and High Representatives, have gathered at the United Nations Conference on Housing and Sustainable Urban Development (Habitat III) from 17 to 20 October 2016 in Quito, with the participation of subnational and local governments, parliamentarians, civil society, indigenous peoples and local communities, the private sector, professionals and practitioners, the scientific and academic community, and other relevant stakeholders, to adopt a New Urban Agenda.

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: United Nations Conference on Housing and Sustainable Urban Development (Habitat III)

textWithHighlights: We, Heads of State and Government, Ministers and High Representatives, have gathered at the {{United Nations Conference on Housing and Sustainable Urban Development (Habitat III)}} from 17 to 20 October 2016 in Quito, with the participation of {{subnational and local governments}}, {{parliamentarians}}, {{civil society}}, {{indigenous peoples and local communities}}, the {{private sector}}, {{professionals and practitioners}}, the {{scientific and academic community}}, and other relevant stakeholders, to adopt a [[New Urban Agenda]].
uncertainties: No explicit operative verb; treat 'to adopt a New Urban Agenda' as a concrete deliverable without an operative verb. Classified New Urban Agenda as 'strategy' (could also be considered 'policy'). Mapped 'scientific and academic community' to normalized 'academia'.

text: By 2050, the world’s urban population is expected to nearly double, making urbanization one of the twenty-first century’s most transformative trends. Populations, economic activities, social and cultural interactions, as well as environmental and humanitarian impacts, are increasingly concentrated in cities, and this poses massive sustainability challenges in terms of housing, infrastructure, basic services, food security, health, education, decent jobs, safety and natural resources, among others.
textWithHighlights: By 2050, the world’s urban population is expected to nearly double, making urbanization one of the twenty-first century’s most transformative trends. Populations, economic activities, social and cultural interactions, as well as environmental and humanitarian impacts, are increasingly concentrated in cities, and this poses massive sustainability challenges in terms of housing, infrastructure, basic services, food security, health, education, decent jobs, safety and natural resources, among others.

text: Since the United Nations Conferences on Human Settlements in Vancouver, Canada, in 1976 and in Istanbul, Turkey, in 1996, and the adoption of the Millennium Development Goals in 2000, we have seen improvements in the quality of life of millions of urban inhabitants, including slum and informal-settlement dwellers. However, the persistence of multiple forms of poverty, growing inequalities and environmental degradation remain among the major obstacles to sustainable development worldwide, with social and economic exclusion and spatial segregation often an irrefutable reality in cities and human settlements.
textWithHighlights: Since the United Nations Conferences on Human Settlements in Vancouver, Canada, in 1976 and in Istanbul, Turkey, in 1996, and the adoption of the Millennium Development Goals in 2000, we have seen improvements in the quality of life of millions of urban inhabitants, including slum and informal-settlement dwellers. However, the persistence of multiple forms of poverty, growing inequalities and environmental degradation remain among the major obstacles to sustainable development worldwide, with social and economic exclusion and spatial segregation often an irrefutable reality in cities and human settlements.
uncertainties: This paragraph is narrative/preambular with no operative verbs, assignees, or concrete deliverables. It references UN conferences and the Millennium Development Goals, which are events/frameworks rather than entities from the provided list, so no mentioned entities were annotated.

text: We are still far from adequately addressing these and other existing and emerging challenges, and there is a need to take advantage of the opportunities presented by urbanization as an engine of sustained and inclusive economic growth, social and cultural development, and environmental protection, and of its potential contributions to the achievement of transformative and sustainable development.
textWithHighlights: We are still far from adequately addressing these and other existing and emerging challenges, and there is a need to take advantage of the opportunities presented by urbanization as an engine of sustained and inclusive economic growth, social and cultural development, and environmental protection, and of its potential contributions to the achievement of transformative and sustainable development.
uncertainties: No operative verbs detected; the text is narrative/evaluative. The phrase “there is a need to” is not an operative verb per the provided list, and no concrete deliverables or assignees are present.

text: By readdressing the way cities and human settlements are planned, designed, financed, developed, governed and managed, the New Urban Agenda will help to end poverty and hunger in all its forms and dimensions; reduce inequalities; promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth; achieve gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls in order to fully harness their vital contribution to sustainable development; improve human health and well-being; foster resilience; and protect the environment.
textWithHighlights: By readdressing the way cities and human settlements are planned, designed, financed, developed, governed and managed, the New Urban Agenda will help to end poverty and hunger in all its forms and dimensions; reduce inequalities; promote sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth; achieve gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls in order to fully harness their vital contribution to sustainable development; improve human health and well-being; foster resilience; and protect the environment.
uncertainties: No operative verb from the controlled list and no explicit assignees or concrete deliverables; the text is aspirational/narrative about expected outcomes of the New Urban Agenda.

text: We take full account of the milestone achievements of the year 2015, in particular the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, including the Sustainable Development Goals, the Addis Ababa Action Agenda of the Third International Conference on Financing for Development, the Paris Agreement adopted under the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change, the Sendai Framework for Disaster Risk Reduction 2015–2030, the Vienna Programme of Action for Landlocked Developing Countries for the Decade 2014–2024, the SIDS Accelerated Modalities of Action (SAMOA) Pathway and the Istanbul Programme of Action for the Least Developed Countries for the Decade 2011–2020. We also take account of the Rio Declaration on Environment and Development, the World Summit on Sustainable Development, the World Summit for Social Development, the Programme of Action of the International Conference on Population and Development, the Beijing Platform for Action, the United Nations Conference on Sustainable Development and the follow-up to these conferences.
textWithHighlights: We *take full account* of the milestone achievements of the year 2015, in particular the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, including the Sustainable Development Goals, the Addis Ababa Action Agenda of the Third International Conference on Financing for Development, the Paris Agreement adopted under the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change, the Sendai Framework for Disaster Risk Reduction 2015–2030, the Vienna Programme of Action for Landlocked Developing Countries for the Decade 2014–2024, the SIDS Accelerated Modalities of Action (SAMOA) Pathway and the Istanbul Programme of Action for the Least Developed Countries for the Decade 2011–2020. We also *take account* of the Rio Declaration on Environment and Development, the World Summit on Sustainable Development, the World Summit for Social Development, the Programme of Action of the International Conference on Population and Development, the Beijing Platform for Action, the United Nations Conference on Sustainable Development and the follow-up to these conferences.
uncertainties: Mapped 'take (full) account of' to the observing verb 'take note'. Treaties/frameworks/platforms mentioned are not annotated as entities per guidance (they are instruments, not organizations).

text: While recognizing that it did not have an intergovernmental agreed outcome, we take note of the World Humanitarian Summit held in May 2016 in Istanbul.
textWithHighlights: While recognizing that it did not have an intergovernmental agreed outcome, we *take note* of the World Humanitarian Summit held in May 2016 in Istanbul.
uncertainties: Considered whether to mark 'World Humanitarian Summit' as a mentioned entity; it is an event rather than an organization/person, so omitted.

text: We acknowledge the contributions of national Governments, as well as the contributions of subnational and local governments, in the definition of the New Urban Agenda, and take note of the second World Assembly of Local and Regional Governments.
textWithHighlights: We *acknowledge* the contributions of {{national Governments}}, as well as the contributions of {{subnational and local governments}}, in the definition of the New Urban Agenda, and *take note* of the second World Assembly of Local and Regional Governments.
uncertainties: Normalized "national Governments" as "Member States"; treated "subnational and local governments" as an 'other' mentioned entity. Did not mark the "second World Assembly of Local and Regional Governments" as an entity since it is an event rather than an organization.

text: The New Urban Agenda reaffirms our global commitment to sustainable urban development as a critical step for realizing sustainable development in an integrated and coordinated manner at the global, regional, national, subnational and local levels, with the participation of all relevant actors. The implementation of the New Urban Agenda contributes to the implementation and localization of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development in an integrated manner, and to the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals and targets, including Goal 11 of making cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable.
textWithHighlights: The New Urban Agenda reaffirms our global commitment to sustainable urban development as a critical step for realizing sustainable development in an integrated and coordinated manner at the global, regional, national, subnational and local levels, with the participation of all relevant actors. The implementation of the New Urban Agenda contributes to the implementation and localization of the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development in an integrated manner, and to the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals and targets, including Goal 11 of making cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable.
uncertainties: The verb 'reaffirms' appears, but the subject is 'The New Urban Agenda', not the General Assembly. This reads as narrative/descriptive rather than an operative action by the Assembly, so no operative verb, assignee, or deliverable was extracted.

text: The New Urban Agenda acknowledges that culture and cultural diversity are sources of enrichment for humankind and provide an important contribution to the sustainable development of cities, human settlements and citizens, empowering them to play an active and unique role in development initiatives. The New Urban Agenda further recognizes that culture should be taken into account in the promotion and implementation of new sustainable consumption and production patterns that contribute to the responsible use of resources and address the adverse impact of climate change.
textWithHighlights: The New Urban Agenda acknowledges that culture and cultural diversity are sources of enrichment for humankind and provide an important contribution to the sustainable development of cities, human settlements and citizens, empowering them to play an active and unique role in development initiatives. The New Urban Agenda further recognizes that culture should be taken into account in the promotion and implementation of new sustainable consumption and production patterns that contribute to the responsible use of resources and address the adverse impact of climate change.

text: Our shared vision

We share a vision of cities for all, referring to the equal use and enjoyment of cities and human settlements, seeking to promote inclusivity and ensure that all inhabitants, of present and future generations, without discrimination of any kind, are able to inhabit and produce just, safe, healthy, accessible, affordable, resilient and sustainable cities and human settlements to foster prosperity and quality of life for all. We note the efforts of some national and local governments to enshrine this vision, referred to as “right to the city”, in their legislation, political declarations and charters.
textWithHighlights: We share a vision of cities for all, referring to the equal use and enjoyment of cities and human settlements, seeking to promote inclusivity and ensure that all inhabitants, of present and future generations, without discrimination of any kind, are able to inhabit and produce just, safe, healthy, accessible, affordable, resilient and sustainable cities and human settlements to foster prosperity and quality of life for all. We *note* the efforts of some {{national and local governments}} to enshrine this vision, referred to as “right to the city”, in their legislation, political declarations and charters.

text: We aim to achieve cities and human settlements where all persons are able to enjoy equal rights and opportunities, as well as their fundamental freedoms, guided by the purposes and principles of the Charter of the United Nations, including full respect for international law. In this regard, the New Urban Agenda is grounded in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, international human rights treaties, the Millennium Declaration and the 2005 World Summit Outcome. It is informed by other instruments such as the Declaration on the Right to Development.
textWithHighlights: We aim to achieve cities and human settlements where all persons are able to enjoy equal rights and opportunities, as well as their fundamental freedoms, guided by the purposes and principles of the Charter of the United Nations, including full respect for international law. In this regard, the New Urban Agenda is grounded in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, international human rights treaties, the Millennium Declaration and the 2005 World Summit Outcome. It is informed by other instruments such as the Declaration on the Right to Development.
uncertainties: No operative verb from the controlled list appears; text is aspirational/narrative. References are to instruments (e.g., UN Charter, UDHR) rather than organizations, so no mentioned entities extracted.

text: We envisage cities and human settlements that:
textWithHighlights: We envisage cities and human settlements that:
uncertainties: The clause appears to be an introductory heading to a list that follows. The verb 'envisage' is not among the controlled operative verbs, so no operative action, assignees or deliverables are extracted here.

text: Fulfil their social function, including the social and ecological function of land, with a view to progressively achieving the full realization of the right to adequate housing as a component of the right to an adequate standard of living, without discrimination, universal access to safe and affordable drinking water and sanitation, as well as equal access for all to public goods and quality services in areas such as food security and nutrition, health, education, infrastructure, mobility and transportation, energy, air quality and livelihoods;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Universal access to water and sanitation
deliverables.deliverable: universal access to safe and affordable drinking water and sanitation

textWithHighlights: Fulfil their social function, including the social and ecological function of land, with a view to progressively achieving the full realization of the right to adequate housing as a component of the right to an adequate standard of living, without discrimination, [[universal access to safe and affordable drinking water and sanitation]], as well as equal access for all to public goods and quality services in areas such as food security and nutrition, health, education, infrastructure, mobility and transportation, energy, air quality and livelihoods;
uncertainties: This subparagraph inherits from a parent clause 'We envisage cities and human settlements that:', which is not an operative verb in the controlled list; thus action verb set to null. Only the water and sanitation access element was treated as a concrete deliverable; other outcomes (e.g., realization of the right to adequate housing; equal access to public goods/services) were considered too broad/aspirational for deliverable annotation.

text: Are participatory, promote civic engagement, engender a sense of belonging and ownership among all their inhabitants, prioritize safe, inclusive, accessible, green and quality public spaces that are friendly for families, enhance social and intergenerational interactions, cultural expressions and political participation, as appropriate, and foster social cohesion, inclusion and safety in peaceful and pluralistic societies, where the needs of all inhabitants are met, recognizing the specific needs of those in vulnerable situations;
textWithHighlights: Are participatory, promote civic engagement, engender a sense of belonging and ownership among all their inhabitants, prioritize safe, inclusive, accessible, green and quality public spaces that are friendly for families, enhance social and intergenerational interactions, cultural expressions and political participation, as appropriate, and foster social cohesion, inclusion and safety in peaceful and pluralistic societies, where the needs of all inhabitants are met, recognizing the specific needs of those in vulnerable situations;
uncertainties: This paragraph is part of a vision list under the parent clause "We envisage cities and human settlements that:". "Envisage" is not in the operative verb list and the text is descriptive, so no operative verb, assignees, or deliverables were extracted.

text: Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls by ensuring women’s full and effective participation and equal rights in all fields and in leadership at all levels of decision-making, by ensuring decent work and equal pay for equal work, or work of equal value, for all women and by preventing and eliminating all forms of discrimination, violence and harassment against women and girls in private and public spaces;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Elimination of discrimination, violence and harassment against women and girls
deliverables.deliverable: preventing and eliminating all forms of discrimination, violence and harassment

textWithHighlights: Achieve [[gender equality]] and [[empower all women and girls]] by ensuring [[women’s full and effective participation]] and [[equal rights]] in all fields and in leadership at all levels of decision-making, by ensuring [[decent work]] and [[equal pay]] for equal work, or work of equal value, for all women and by [[preventing and eliminating all forms of discrimination, violence and harassment]] against women and girls in private and public spaces;
uncertainties: This appears to be part of a vision/aspirational list rather than an operative directive. No explicit assignee or operative verb is present; deliverables are interpreted as policy outcomes. The categorization of all items under 'policy' may be broader than intended.

text: Meet the challenges and opportunities of present and future sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, leveraging urbanization for structural transformation, high productivity, value-added activities and resource efficiency, harnessing local economies and taking note of the contribution of the informal economy while supporting a sustainable transition to the formal economy;
textWithHighlights: Meet the challenges and opportunities of present and future sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth, leveraging urbanization for structural transformation, high productivity, value-added activities and resource efficiency, harnessing local economies and taking note of the contribution of the informal economy while supporting a sustainable transition to the formal economy;
uncertainties: This sentence is part of a vision list under 'We envisage cities and human settlements that:' and does not contain an operative verb from the controlled list nor any concrete directive tasks or assignees.

text: Fulfil their territorial functions across administrative boundaries and act as hubs and drivers for balanced, sustainable and integrated urban and territorial development at all levels;
textWithHighlights: Fulfil their territorial functions across administrative boundaries and act as hubs and drivers for balanced, sustainable and integrated urban and territorial development at all levels;
uncertainties: This appears to be a vision subparagraph under 'We envisage cities and human settlements that:', which is not an operative clause per the controlled verb list, so no operative verb/assignee/deliverable extracted.

text: Promote age- and gender-responsive planning and investment for sustainable, safe and accessible urban mobility for all and resource-efficient transport systems for passengers and freight, effectively linking people, places, goods, services and economic opportunities;
textWithHighlights: Promote age- and gender-responsive planning and investment for sustainable, safe and accessible urban mobility for all and resource-efficient transport systems for passengers and freight, effectively linking people, places, goods, services and economic opportunities;
uncertainties: This appears to be a visionary subparagraph under “We envisage cities and human settlements that:”. “Promote” is not in the exhaustive operative verb list, and no assignee is specified; thus no operative verb or deliverables were extracted.

text: Adopt and implement disaster risk reduction and management, reduce vulnerability, build resilience and responsiveness to natural and human-made hazards and foster mitigation of and adaptation to climate change;
textWithHighlights: Adopt and implement [[disaster risk reduction and management]], reduce vulnerability, build resilience and responsiveness to natural and human-made hazards and foster mitigation of and adaptation to climate change;
uncertainties: No explicit operative verb; treated as a vision statement. Extracted only the most concrete element as a policy deliverable; other phrases (reduce vulnerability, build resilience, foster mitigation/adaptation) are broad and not treated as deliverables.

text: Protect, conserve, restore and promote their ecosystems, water, natural habitats and biodiversity, minimize their environmental impact and change to sustainable consumption and production patterns.
textWithHighlights: Protect, conserve, restore and promote their ecosystems, water, natural habitats and biodiversity, minimize their environmental impact and change to sustainable consumption and production patterns.
uncertainties: This appears under the parent clause 'We envisage cities and human settlements that:', describing envisioned characteristics rather than assigning tasks; thus no operative verb, assignee, or concrete deliverable extracted.

text: Our principles and commitments
To achieve our vision, we resolve to adopt a New Urban Agenda guided by the following interlinked principles:
textWithHighlights: To achieve our vision, we *resolve* to adopt a [[New Urban Agenda]] guided by the following interlinked principles:
uncertainties: "Adopt" could be interpreted as the operative verb; selected "resolve" as the main operative verb. The New Urban Agenda is categorized as a policy, though it could also be seen as a strategy.

text: Leave no one behind, by ending poverty in all its forms and dimensions, including the eradication of extreme poverty, by ensuring equal rights and opportunities, socioeconomic and cultural diversity, and integration in the urban space, by enhancing liveability, education, food security and nutrition, health and well-being, including by ending the epidemics of AIDS, tuberculosis and malaria, by promoting safety and eliminating discrimination and all forms of violence, by ensuring public participation — providing safe and equal access for all, and by providing equal access for all to physical and social infrastructure and basic services, as well as adequate and affordable housing;
textWithHighlights: Leave no one behind, by ending poverty in all its forms and dimensions, including the eradication of extreme poverty, by ensuring equal rights and opportunities, socioeconomic and cultural diversity, and integration in the urban space, by enhancing liveability, education, food security and nutrition, health and well-being, including by ending the epidemics of AIDS, tuberculosis and malaria, by promoting safety and eliminating discrimination and all forms of violence, by ensuring public participation — providing safe and equal access for all, and by providing equal access for all to physical and social infrastructure and basic services, as well as adequate and affordable housing;
uncertainties: This appears to be a principles/commitments subparagraph under a parent clause and lacks an explicit operative verb or concrete assignable tasks. While many outcome goals are listed (e.g., ending poverty, providing housing), they are broad aspirations rather than actionable deliverables per the defined categories, so no deliverables are extracted.

text: Ensure sustainable and inclusive urban economies by leveraging the agglomeration benefits of well-planned urbanization, including high productivity, competitiveness and innovation, by promoting full and productive employment and decent work for all, by ensuring the creation of decent jobs and equal access for all to economic and productive resources and opportunities and by preventing land speculation, promoting secure land tenure and managing urban shrinking, where appropriate;
textWithHighlights: Ensure sustainable and inclusive urban economies by leveraging the agglomeration benefits of well-planned urbanization, including high productivity, competitiveness and innovation, by promoting full and productive employment and decent work for all, by ensuring the creation of decent jobs and equal access for all to economic and productive resources and opportunities and by preventing land speculation, promoting secure land tenure and managing urban shrinking, where appropriate;
uncertainties: This appears as a subparagraph under a parent clause stating “we resolve to adopt … guided by the following interlinked principles”; hence the operative verb is inherited (“resolve”). The content is aspirational/principle-like, so no concrete deliverables or explicit assignees are extracted.

text: Ensure environmental sustainability by promoting clean energy and sustainable use of land and resources in urban development, by protecting ecosystems and biodiversity, including adopting healthy lifestyles in harmony with nature, by promoting sustainable consumption and production patterns, by building urban resilience, by reducing disaster risks and by mitigating and adapting to climate change.
textWithHighlights: Ensure environmental sustainability by promoting clean energy and sustainable use of land and resources in urban development, by protecting ecosystems and biodiversity, including adopting healthy lifestyles in harmony with nature, by promoting sustainable consumption and production patterns, by building urban resilience, by reducing disaster risks and by mitigating and adapting to climate change.

text: We commit ourselves to working towards an urban paradigm shift for a New Urban Agenda that will:
textWithHighlights: We *commit* ourselves to working towards an urban paradigm shift for a New Urban Agenda that will:
uncertainties: This appears to be a parent clause introducing subparagraphs; subsequent items likely inherit the deciding verb 'commit' and the implicit assignee (GA). No concrete deliverable is specified in this line.

text: Readdress the way we plan, finance, develop, govern and manage cities and human settlements, recognizing sustainable urban and territorial development as essential to the achievement of sustainable development and prosperity for all;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Readdress planning, financing, development, governance and management of cities and human settlements
deliverables.deliverable: Readdress the way we plan, finance, develop, govern and manage cities and human settlements

textWithHighlights: [[Readdress the way we plan, finance, develop, govern and manage cities and human settlements]], recognizing sustainable urban and territorial development as essential to the achievement of sustainable development and prosperity for all;
uncertainties: This subparagraph inherits the operative verb ('commit') and the assignee from the parent clause ('We commit ourselves to...'). Using GA as the normalized assignee assumes the resolution subject applies to the annex text; in practice, 'we' may refer to Member States participating in Habitat III.

text: Recognize the leading role of national Governments, as appropriate, in the definition and implementation of inclusive and effective urban policies and legislation for sustainable urban development, and the equally important contributions of subnational and local governments, as well as civil society and other relevant stakeholders, in a transparent and accountable manner;
textWithHighlights: *Recognize* the leading role of {{national Governments}}, as appropriate, in the definition and implementation of inclusive and effective urban policies and legislation for sustainable urban development, and the equally important contributions of {{subnational and local governments}}, as well as {{civil society}} and other relevant stakeholders, in a transparent and accountable manner;
uncertainties: This paragraph appears under a parent clause "We commit ourselves ... that will:"; although an inherited deciding verb (commit) could apply, the subparagraph uses its own operative verb (Recognize), which is treated as the main verb. Mapping "national Governments" to "Member States" is approximate; "subnational and local governments" are classified as 'other' due to lack of a specific category.

text: Adopt sustainable, people-centred, age- and gender-responsive and integrated approaches to urban and territorial development by implementing policies, strategies, capacity development and actions at all levels, based on fundamental drivers of change, including:

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Policies on urban and territorial development
Strategies on urban and territorial development
Capacity development on urban and territorial development

textWithHighlights: Adopt sustainable, people-centred, age- and gender-responsive and integrated approaches to urban and territorial development by implementing [[policies]], [[strategies]], [[capacity development]] and actions at all levels, based on fundamental drivers of change, including:
uncertainties: This subparagraph appears under the parent clause “We commit ourselves to working towards an urban paradigm shift for a New Urban Agenda that will:”, so the operative verb is inherited as “commit” and the assignee is the General Assembly. The deliverables are interpreted as implementing policies, strategies, and capacity development; “actions” is considered too vague to mark as a deliverable.

text: Developing and implementing urban policies at the appropriate level, including in local-national and multi-stakeholder partnerships, building integrated systems of cities and human settlements and promoting cooperation among all levels of government to enable the achievement of sustainable integrated urban development;

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Integrated systems of cities and human settlements
deliverables.deliverable: integrated systems of cities and human settlements

textWithHighlights: Developing and implementing [[urban policies]] at the appropriate level, including in local-national and multi-stakeholder partnerships, building [[integrated systems of cities and human settlements]] and promoting cooperation among all levels of government to enable the achievement of sustainable integrated urban development;

The categorization of “integrated systems of cities and human settlements” as a strategy (rather than infrastructure) is interpretative.

text: Strengthening urban governance, with sound institutions and mechanisms that empower and include urban stakeholders, as well as appropriate checks and balances, providing predictability and coherence in urban development plans to enable social inclusion, sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth and environmental protection;
textWithHighlights: Strengthening urban governance, with sound institutions and mechanisms that empower and include urban stakeholders, as well as appropriate checks and balances, providing predictability and coherence in urban development plans to enable social inclusion, sustained, inclusive and sustainable economic growth and environmental protection;
uncertainties: Treated as a subparagraph inheriting the verb 'adopt' from the parent clause ('Adopt sustainable... including:'). No concrete, actionable deliverables or explicit assignees are stated in this line.

text: Reinvigorating long-term and integrated urban and territorial planning and design in order to optimize the spatial dimension of the urban form and deliver the positive outcomes of urbanization;
textWithHighlights: Reinvigorating long-term and integrated urban and territorial planning and design in order to optimize the spatial dimension of the urban form and deliver the positive outcomes of urbanization;
uncertainties: This appears to be a gerund sub-item under a parent clause (“Adopt … including:”), so it could inherit the operative verb “adopt,” but the wording is non-procedural and lacks a clear assignee or concrete deliverable. I therefore left verb/assignee/deliverables empty.

text: Supporting effective, innovative and sustainable financing frameworks and instruments enabling strengthened municipal finance and local fiscal systems in order to create, sustain and share the value generated by sustainable urban development in an inclusive manner.

textWithHighlights: Supporting effective, innovative and sustainable [[financing frameworks and instruments]] enabling strengthened municipal finance and local fiscal systems in order to create, sustain and share the value generated by sustainable urban development in an inclusive manner.

text: Call for action

While the specific circumstances of cities of all sizes, towns and villages vary, we affirm that the New Urban Agenda is universal in scope, participatory and people-centred, protects the planet and has a long-term vision, setting out priorities and actions at the global, regional, national, subnational and local levels that Governments and other relevant stakeholders in every country can adopt based on their needs.
textWithHighlights: While the specific circumstances of cities of all sizes, towns and villages vary, we *affirm* that the New Urban Agenda is universal in scope, participatory and people-centred, protects the planet and has a long-term vision, setting out priorities and actions at the global, regional, national, subnational and local levels that {{Governments}} and other relevant stakeholders in every country can adopt based on their needs.
uncertainties: The operative verb used is 'affirm', which is not explicitly listed in the provided exhaustive verb list; it is treated here as a reinforcing verb akin to 'reaffirm'.

text: We will work to implement the New Urban Agenda in our own countries and at the regional and global levels, taking into account different national realities, capacities and levels of development, and respecting national legislation and practices, as well as policies and priorities.

deliverables.deliverable_normalized: Implementation of the New Urban Agenda

textWithHighlights: We will work to [[implement the New Urban Agenda]] in our own countries and at the regional and global levels, taking into account different national realities, capacities and levels of development, and respecting national legislation and practices, as well as policies and priorities.
uncertainties: No explicit operative verb from the controlled list; treated as a deliverable commitment without assigning 'we' to GA or Member States explicitly.

text: We reaffirm all the principles of the Rio Declaration on Environment and Development, including, inter alia, the principle of common but differentiated responsibilities, as set out in principle 7.
textWithHighlights: We *reaffirm* all the principles of the Rio Declaration on Environment and Development, including, inter alia, the principle of common but differentiated responsibilities, as set out in principle 7.

text: We acknowledge that in implementing the New Urban Agenda particular attention should be given to addressing the unique and emerging urban development challenges facing all countries, in particular developing countries, including African countries, least developed countries, landlocked developing countries and small island developing States, as well as the specific challenges facing middle-income countries. Special attention should also be given to countries in situations of conflict, as well as countries and territories under foreign occupation, post-conflict countries and countries affected by natural and human-made disasters.

mentioned_entities.mentioned_entity: countries and territories under foreign occupation
